page.title: 03ST.ANDREW'S CHURCH (1965)
page.content: St.Andrew's Church is situated along Northaw Road East,facing Station Road. It is one of three churches in Cuffley. on the front,outside,is a large cross which lights up at night. it is built on a slope and it has an undercroft where children attend Sunday School during adults' service from 09.30 until 10.15,a children's choir participate in this service.The stained glass windows have words in them saying,"The Earth Is The Lord's And All That There In Is,"another window represents"The Tree Of Life"and was put in recently in memory of Rev.M.Bryant.The present vicar is Rev.J.Sykes.The architect was Mr.Clifford Culpin,who lived for many years in Carbone Hill.In 1968 the church became the first building in the parish to qualify for a Civic Trust Award for its good design.
